Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell and Devon Conway scored half-centuries for New Zealand
Mitchell Santner took 2 wickets for 11 runs and bowled a maiden over
Arshdeep Singh and Shivam Mavi made excellent comebacks in overs 18 and 19
Washington Sundar took a spectacular one-handed return-catch diving full length to his right
Post-Match Reflections: Daryl Mitchell said Mitchell Santner is one of the best white-ball spinners at the moment
New Zealand captain Daryl Mitchell praised his team's performance and said they managed to score what turned out to be enough off India's fast bowlers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sharply cut grass perhaps did the trick for New Zealand as the ball didn't quite become a bar of soap and kept gripping for their spinners
The pitch turned, and New Zealand managed to score 176 runs, while India scored 155 runs in 20 overs
Others: New Zealand won the match by 21 runs and took a 1-0 lead in the T20I series
India lost early wickets, and their spinners were unable to control the match
